Description: Rim and upper bowl sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup, probably a type A cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: faded black band below rim; black-figure decoration consisting of battle scene: part of warrior to right, with helmet, Boeotian shield with added red around rim and added white for device of dot and two rings, white baldric and spear; at right, rider (foreparts of horse and rider's left leg remaining), to left.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 446, no. B739)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0631) (Phase 1)
